dc:description: ["The two prison datasets Kaisheim and Wasserburg cover male and female prison inmates in southern Germany. The usual selectivity problems of prison records should be taken into account. However
column2: Baten (1997) intensively discusses how selective-on-observables the prison records were by comparing the share of occupations with the census distribution of these occupations
column4: while covering a less skilled share of the population
column5: quite a variety of different occupations are included. The trends in height are also similar to (non-selective) military conscript data covering the same region of Germany (see the discussion of the Bavarian conscripts
column7: which suggests that selection on unobservables does not play a substantial role. The regional differentiation is by Bavarian districts
column9: of which about 300 existed in Bavaria
column10: as well as some foreign prisoners. The dataset covers the intermediate period of the 19th century
